alert.note: Alert for Mason; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 11:08PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Menard and central Mason Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1107 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grit, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mason, Art, Long Mountain, Grit, Saline, Streeter, Hext, Hedwigs Hill, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, Erna, Us- 377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line and Koockville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Texas.
